title: Classic Macaroni Salad Recipe (with Video)
description: This easy macaroni salad with crunchy veggies tossed in a creamy, tangy dressing is always a popular side dish at every cookout, potluck, and picnic!

macaroni salad always gets lots of compliments. It's an easy recipe to make with macaroni pasta, celery, onion, bell pepper, carrot, and pimentos and has a pleasing tangy dressing that everyone seems to love! Submitted by Graden Updated on January 27, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 162 162 162 162 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 4 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 30 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This creamy macaroni salad with celery, onion, green pepper, carrot, and pimentos is easy to make and is the perfect crowd-pleasing dish to bring to your next picnic or potluck.¬† How to Make Macaroni Salad You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Macaroni Salad Ingredients These are the ingredients you‚Äôll need to make this macaroni salad recipe:¬† Macaroni: Of course, you‚Äôll need macaroni pasta!Condiments: A creamy blend of mayonnaise and yellow mustard adds tons of flavor.¬†Sugar and vinegar: White sugar adds a dose of sweetness, which is pleasantly balanced by white vinegar.¬†Seasonings: This macaroni salad is simply seasoned with salt and ground black pepper.¬†Vegetables: You‚Äôll need celery, an onion, and a bell pepper. Grated carrots and pimento peppers are optional, but they add welcome flavor and color.¬† How Do You Make Macaroni Salad?¬† Here‚Äôs a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade macaroni salad:¬† Cook the macaroni in salted water.¬†Mix the mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, mustard, and seasonings together.¬†Stir in the macaroni and remaining ingredients. Chill in the refrigerator. Can You Make Macaroni Salad Ahead of Time?¬† Yes, macaroni salad makes a great make-ahead potluck dish. In fact, since the flavors need time to meld in the refrigerator, it might actually be better to make it a day or two in advance.¬† How Long Does Macaroni Salad Last?¬† This homemade macaroni salad can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days. We don‚Äôt recommend freezing this recipe, as the noodles will likely become mushy after they are thawed.¬† Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise ‚ÄúThis recipe is fantastic, I tasted it when I finished mixing,‚Äù says Sue Newman. ‚ÄúWOW, can't wait for it to get cold. I did make a couple of changesL I used celery salt instead of just salt and left the green pepper and pimento out.‚Äù ‚ÄúGreat flavor,‚Äù raves one Allrecipes community member. ‚ÄúI used cellentani pasta and only ‚Öì cup sugar. Also used some garlic powder and did not use bell pepper or pimento. Perfect accompaniment to our BBQ.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is a fantastic pasta salad,‚Äù according to Rebecca Timbers. ‚ÄúThe only drawback is I have found is that now I am required to bring a big bowl to every family gathering no matter the season or holiday!‚Äù Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 4 cups uncooked elbow macaroni 1 cup mayonnaise ‚Öî cup white sugar, or to taste ¬º cup distilled white vinegar 2 ¬Ω tablespoons prepared yellow mustard 1 ¬Ω teaspoons salt ¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper 2 stalks celery, chopped 1 large onion, chopped 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped ¬º cup grated carrot (Optional) 2 tablespoons chopped pimento peppers (Optional) Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook macaroni pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Rinse under cold water and drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper, and macaroni pasta together in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in celery, onion, green pepper, carrot, and pimentos. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Refrigerate salad for at least 4 hours before serving, but preferably overnight. I used half a green bell pepper, 1/2 red bell pepper, and added cubed cheddar and Colby jack cheeses to it for some protein. I‚Äôll make again for sure! 04 of 162 Photo by¬† Windsleigher 09/26/2023 Easy and delicious! 05 of 162 Photo by¬† Greg Tansy 07/10/2023 Omitted onion, but came out üëç great! 06 of 162 Photo by¬† Rochelle Matsel Simon 06/09/2023 This is my go to for cookouts or get togethers! Everyone raves about it üòä only thing I do differently is add lots of eggs ü•ö we love eggy macaroni salad ‚ô•Ô∏è 07 of 162 Photo by¬† soapscrubs 05/31/2023 I thought it might be too oniony or mustardy for the fam, but nope, all good! The celery provides that necessary crunch, the carrots and peppers are pleasing, and there's just a hint of creaminess from the dressing, not too overpowering. 08 of 162 Photo by¬† Toni _ 07/23/2022 Let it marinate together over night.STIR STIR STIR! It will come out perfectI've made this quite a few times at this point. First few rounds I stuck to the recipe exactly how it calls for. I really wouldn't do anything different except adding more carrots for the crunch. I used carrot chips. I added 3 heavy table spoons of roasted red peppers and it doesn't look noticeable so I may or may not add more in the future. Stick to the recipe exactly as it calls. I have gotten so many compliments and requests for it.STIR STIR STIR.. Stir it around after making and before serving. The macaroni absorbs the liquids so stir it. It will be perfection. 09 of 162 Photo by¬† MEANDGOD 07/04/2022 Easy and delicious 10 of 162 Photo by¬† OrangeRoast1207 04/08/2022 This is one of the best recipes I found so far but made a few changes - I used less sugar and little less vinegar, I also replaced the green bell pepper with red bell pepper. I added a little more mayo and about a 1/4 cup of sour cream.
